page.title: 10FARM DIARY: ACCIDENT & DEATH
page.content: 13 February. Mum and I called at the vet's to collect a drench for a ewe with suspected twin lamb disease. A Charolais heifer somehow got itself upturned in one of the side troughs in the silage yard so Dad and I lifted it out by tying some rope to its front legs and tying the other end of the rope to the loader on the tractor. We then lifted the loader up and the heifer came out slowly. When the heifer stood up we noticed she had one of her horns knocked off, so we put her in a shed by herself overnight. 14 February The ewe with the twin lamb disease died this morning. Another of our Ayrshire cows calved. It had a Simmental bull calf.
